Description: Limestone figure of a bound prisoner, similar to EA 23825. This small example is carved in a summary fashion, with working planes evident and very schematic details. Arms and legs bound as in figures EA 26825-26828; 23830. High headdress with a pointed top.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Found to the east of the "Qasr" annex, beyond Petrie's chamber 29
Curator's comments: W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70, pl. xl, 13, see also p. 53 § 51, p. 54 § 53. This is one of a group of about 30 to 40 similar figures, all found together, of which 5 others are London, BM, EA 23825 to 23828, 23830). See also Oxford, AM, 1887.2496-2497 (2 items); Boston, MFA, 87.810-814 (= RES.87.121-125; 5 items altogether); Liverpool, 3.2.87.8; Bristol, H 1987, H1132 (?)
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70, pl. xl, 13, see also p. 53 § 51, p. 54 § 53)

Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.44, p.58, p.78, p.178, pl.20) (p.78 - refers to unlocated iron object (EA23829/1887,0101.742), number in paper may be incorrect)
